summary: Personal finance tracking application for income, expenses, and savings with daily, monthly, and yearly views and comparison charts

existing_features.title: Create a frontend dashboard displaying a list of tracked vessels with their current status including name, position coordinates, speed, and last update time
Add a form to input new vessel tracking data including vessel name, latitude, longitude, speed, and heading

Design a cohesive maritime-themed visual style with oceanic colors (teals, navy blues, seafoam greens), clean typography suitable for data display, and nautical-inspired UI elements that create a professional vessel tracking interface
Replace vessel form with finance entry form supporting input of amount, date, category, and type selection (income/expense/saving)
Replace vessel list with finance dashboard displaying three separate sections for income, expenses, and savings entries with daily, monthly, and yearly view toggles
Implement comparison chart component visualizing income, expenses, and savings over selected time period with line or bar chart
Replace maritime theme with financial/professional theme using green for income, red for expenses, blue for savings, with clean typography and data-focused design
Add a delete button (icon) next to each individual finance entry in the FinanceSection component that allows users to remove income, expense, and savings entries
Connect frontend delete buttons to backend delete mutation using React Query, with optimistic updates and error handling

new_feature_requests.summary: Create data model to store income/salary entries with amount, date, and category
Create data model to store expense entries with amount, date, and category
Create data model to store savings entries with amount, date, and target/goal
Implement forms to input income, expenses, and savings data
Display income, expenses, and savings in daily, monthly, and yearly views
Create comparison charts to visualize income vs expenses vs savings over time periods

Replace vessel tracking data models with finance tracking models: create FinanceEntry type with fields for amount (Float), date (Int timestamp), category (Text), and entry type (income/expense/saving)
Implement backend functions to add, update, retrieve, and delete finance entries with filtering by date range and entry type
Add delete functionality to remove individual income, expense, and savings entries from the dashboard
Implement backend delete functionality that removes finance entries by ID with ownership validation to ensure users can only delete their own entries
